extendedIngredients.name: lime juice
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Tbsps plus 2 tsps fresh, squeezed lime juice

title: Quickie Dinner Week: Tilapia Tacos
summary: The recipe Quickie Dinner Week: Tilapia Tacos could satisfy your Mexican craving in around 10 minutes. This recipe serves 2 and costs $5.94 per serving. This main course has 717 calories, 61g of protein, and 29g of fat per serving. If you have squeezed lime juice, lettuce, expeller grapeseed oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the yogurt you could follow this main course with the 5-Minute Healthy Peach Frozen Yogurt as a dessert. 14 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a pescatarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 93%. This score is excellent. Similar recipes include Quickie Black Bean Tacos, TILAPIA FISH TACOS (TACOS DE TILAPIA), and Quickie Quickie Quiche.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: GIFFT by Kathie Lee Gifford Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: GIFFT Pinot Grigio bursts with lively pear and tropical fruits, balanced by crisp acidity and an elegantly refined freshness. Featuring ripe stone fruit and citrus aromas, this wine showcases melon, nectarine and Meyer lemon flavors that finish light and refreshing.

instructions: Preheat oven to 425.Spraycooking spray on abaking sheet with edgesand set aside.In a medium bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons lime juice, oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Place tilapia on prepared baking sheet and spoon mix over top. Bake in oven for 10 minutes, or until the fish flakes when tested with a fork. Transfer to a bowl and flake apart in chunks.In a separate bowl, whisk together the yogurt, mayonnaise, cilantro, 2 teaspoons of lime juiceand 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Warm tortilla's in oven for 1 minute.Place yogurt mix, lettuce,warm tortillasand fishon table and allow each familymember to assemble tacos.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 425.Spraycooking spray on abaking sheet with edgesand set aside.In a medium bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons lime juice, oil and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Place tilapia on prepared baking sheet and spoon mix over top.
Bake in oven for 10 minutes, or until the fish flakes when tested with a fork.

Transfer to a bowl and flake apart in chunks.In a separate bowl, whisk together the yogurt, mayonnaise, cilantro, 2 teaspoons of lime juiceand 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Warm tortilla's in oven for 1 minute.
Place yogurt mix, lettuce,warm tortillasand fishon table and allow each familymember to assemble tacos.
